subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] QS-SAMPA: a proposed format for plain-text Quickscript
msgSnippet: ... I hadn t thought of that. That would mean you could use the ` for quotes just like you did before. So in light of that solution, I guess I could move the
messageBody:
Benct Philip Jonsson wrote:



You could create an escape sequence for the namer dot.

\def\*{\char96}

so you can write

``mY nem z \*pQl!''

AFAIK \* is not already in use in TeX. Else you can use \n
``my nem z \n pQl!'' although that looks much less elegant.

The namer dot is not used *that* often after all --
personally I tend to use it at the first occurrence of a
name but not afterwards. After all most scripts on this
planet (Arabic, Hebrew, Devanagari, Korean, Mongolian,
Chinese...) get along just fine with no capital letters or
equivalent indicators.

.

I hadn't thought of that. That would mean you could use the "`" for quotes just like you did before. So in light of that solution, I guess I could move the namer dot to the backquote key.  If I don't hear any objections, that's what I'll do.

Paul
(\*pOl!)

(I'm sending this message in plain text and HTML. If people like John Cowan see a bunch of HTML tags, let me know and I'll just do plain text from now on.)
